text:
<optional title, max 6 words>

A tense encounter in a dim room

Raskolnikov holds a cigarette case nervously.  
Old Woman: “What is it?”  
Raskolnikov: “A thing… cigarette case… Silver.”  

---

Old Woman examines the case, back turned.  
Old Woman: “It doesn’t seem like silver…”  
Raskolnikov (thought): “Now or never.”  

---

He pulls out the axe, trembling.  
Raskolnikov (thought): “Don’t drop it!”  
Old Woman: “Why is it wrapped like this?”  

---

Raskolnikov swings the axe, eyes wide.  
Raskolnikov: “I’m sorry…”  
Old Woman: “What—”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, overwhelmed by fear and desperation, attacks the old woman with an axe as she turns her back to him.
